answers.author: Pamela Muse
answers.text:
Michael – I hope the following is helpful:
West Linn, OR
http://westlinnoregon.gov/parksrec/parks-areas-facilities-naming-policy 
Ottawa, CAN
http://ottawa.ca/en/city-hall/your-city-government/policies-and-administrative-structure/commemorative-naming-policy
Portland, OR (2 links)
http://www.portlandoregon.gov/parks/article/217384 
http://www.portlandonline.com/auditor/index.cfm?a=68091&c=36767 
Vacaville, CA
http://www.cityofvacaville.com/index.aspx?page=552 
College Station, TX – PPT
http://www.slideshare.net/ColinKillian/naming-policy-for-city-facilities 
Pam
Pamela Muse
Western Regional Director
Alliance for Innovation
888-468-6450 Office
480-231-3538 Text
pmuse@transformgov.org
www.transformgov.org

author: Michael Stauffer
text:
Hello. The City of Encinitas, CA is looking in to developing a policy related to naming rights for parks, sports fields, buildings, etc. If you have such a policy, please email it to me at mstauffer@encinitasca.gov.
Thank you,
Mike
title: Naming Rights Policy
